alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 26 at 8:56PM CDT until July 29 at 10:33PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Missouri... Cuivre River at Old Monroe. Cuivre River near Troy. Dardenne Creek at St. Peters. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Cuivre River at Old Monroe. * WHEN...Until late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 27.0 feet, Right bank overflows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 25.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM CDT Tuesday was 25.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 26.8 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (7:00 am) Location Stg Stage Thu Fri Sat Sun Mon Cuivre River Old Monroe 24.0 25.5 25.6 15.1 14.3 14.1 14.0 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Rainfall heavier than forecast could cause river levels to rise even higher than predicted. The National Weather Service will monitor this developing situation and issue follow up statements as conditions change. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
